Comment.value: DaelanC2greet is 0.  DaelanWork is 0.  Initial greeting.  When the player first meets him in chapter 2.  Set DaelanC2greet to 1.  Do this later on in the dialogue, about 3 dialogue nodes in (I have marked those as well).   The player doesn't have the henchman's personal item (daelanpersonal).

value.0: I am Grimgnaw, a monk of the Order of the Long Death. The grisly account of the Academy is no great secret, <FirstName>. Not to those who seek such things out.
In truth my skills are not so different from any soldier or hired blade, though I embrace the beauty and perfection of my enemy's death with a zeal others often lack.

The monks of the Long Death rarely join with those outside our order, but I sense the mark of my master is upon you. I will fight by your side in return for some of the treasure we find, so that I may accomplish my mission.
Should you decide you need an ally in your cause, <FirstName>, I will gladly join you... unless of course, there is another dealer of death around.
There are many who can offer me the chance to revel in the joys of killing and death - and they will do so without the company of others.
If you find yourself without a companion, then return to me and we will bring much death to others.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, I do not foresee a future of slaughter and death with the others. Return to me if you find yourself without a companion.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> You... may be right. Together, with all of us, we will make the Order proud!
I foresee a future of brutal and savage slaughter at your side, <FirstName>. My Order will be pleased.

Comment.value: DaelanC3greet is 1.  DaelanWork is 0. Default greeting in chapter 3 (the player has already talked to him once).
Default dialogue when the henchman is a member of the player's party.

value.0: We part now, but you are destined to swim in an ocean of blood. Our fates are intertwined, and I shall wait in Port Llast for your inevitable return so we may once more join together to perform the will of the Silent Lord.

Comment.value: This starting condition should only come up if the henchman is working for a player and it is NOT that player who is trying to talk to him (the script NW_CH_JOIN_NOT only checks to see if the henchman is working for ANY player, including the one he is currently serving).

value.0: Beware, lest I deliver you to the Silent Lord.
I could use a monk at my side. Welcome to the team, Grimgnaw.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You know what they say, the more numbers we have, the more we can kill. Please reconsider and join us.
I'd like to buy off some of the loot that you picked up.
I'd like to buy off some of the loot that you picked up.
